posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
In short:
Suggestion to allow for multiple seperate (user) profiles within Signal Priavate Messenger. Either one for each SIM for dual Sim phones, or any number of user defined profiles to which a conversation can assigned.

This is a suggestion for a feature which other messenging apps seem to not have put any effort in yet. Therefore, implementing this might also give signal an edge and some publicity.
But besides that its just something some of us expected would be standard in 2018. Need to have.

I for one have a dual sim phone. In my case one sim for private use, anothe for business. The business sim I may take out of my phone once or twice a year to hand over to a buisness partner.

The issue:
In messaging apps including signal, all conversations are part of one account. They are all mixed together. On top of that (issue 2) my buisness partners can see the same profile as my family. This is rather restricting. My mother can see what my girlfriend can see and what my clients can also see. Just take a minute to imagine that. Yea that sucks right?

Suggestion:
Multiple (user) profiles in signal.
Its a rather drastic step, I know. But think about it. Its human nature to uphold different identities. And this is also what privacy is about. I for one would love to keep those identities seperate.
The solution could be to have one identify for each sim card, or the solution could be to allow users to make infinite profiles and group contacts in them.

I know this would be a massive undertaking, all I ask is that we think about this. Could this be something we want?

Addition:
Both solutions are also relevant to single SIM phones!

  • In case of coupling a profile to a certain SIM instead of a certain phone, a user can switch his SIM for another one and also assume a different identity to use with it.
  • In case of user defined profiles coupled to certain conversations, it obviously doesnt matter how many SIMs are in the phone, it will also be of use to single SIM phones.

posts.name: Leonardo Porpora
posts.cooked:
If you’re an Android user, you’re in luck. You likely have never used this feature, but Android supports multiple user accounts on a single device. Each user account has its own set of apps and app data. You can create a second user account on your device specifically for your second Signal number.

Open the Settings app, select Users, and select “Add user or profile” to add a new user. After creating a new user, log in to it and install the Signal app. Don’t forget to set up screen lock for the new user — otherwise, anyone with physical access to your phone will be able to easily access the Signal messages in your second user, even if your main user account is locked.

To switch between users on your phone, drag the notification bar down and tap on the user icon.

Link: Talk To Strangers on Signal With a Public Phone Number

link_counts.title: How to Use Signal Without Giving Out Your Phone Number

posts.name: Arik
posts.cooked: When you change users, the previous users’ applications don’t work.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I don’t think the option I am looking for exists at this time. What this feature reqeust is about is full seperation. For example in the case of dual sim:

  • Have 2 signal user accounts
  • Ability to appoint which signal user account belongs with which android user account

Or:

  • Have 2 signal user accounts
  • Ability to appoint which sim card in linked to which signal user account

Or:
Both of the above combined. Somehow.

And with each signal user account, allow the user to set adiferent name, different profile picture, different security number, different description. To a point where someone with my work number could also chat with my private number and have no idea they are the same person from the same phone. This way I can comfortably have a public number and a private number on the same phone, without wondering if anyone with my work number can see my silly profile picture on my private account.

This is tough, it seems Android isn’t completely ready for this level of seperation, because on my android 7.0 I cant find a way to effectivly couple one sim card to one abdroid account and the other to another android account. There is an option for it, but I am not sure this really seperates in app identities.

The only thing I am willing to leave an option to link to both accounts is notification. For instance get a notification on your android work account that signal has received a message on your android private account.

Why is this so difficult with phones these days, it’s 2018. This is a must have.

This would be handy for those who want to separate business from personal. I know wire allows up to three accounts to be synced to their desktop device. This would be a great feature to have for Signal for mobile and desktop apps.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: Telegram for example lets me add accounts, one for each sim card in my phone. The downside is that I have to bind my account to my phone number(s) (which Signal also does at this time!). The upside is easy switching between work and personal communications. I could even export the work conversations to an other pone if someone else is appointed to handle communications for our business.

Support for dual SIM phones, i.e. two or more phone numbers on the same device would be very nice. This means being able to receive and send Signal messages on both numbers. The user interface could be like the default SMS app. With that you can set for every sms which number to use and it remembers the least number used per contact.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Of course the core of this issue is that we can not register two phone numbers on the same phone:

Signal support center:

Does Signal allow multiple accounts on one phone or one account on multiple phones?
Signal can only be registered to one phone number per mobile device. If you have a dual SIM phone, you must choose one number to register with Signal.

The second issue is that the user interface requires a way of switching between two accounts. Not only should we be able to switch between views for the messages, but there should be two separate profiles too. everything should be double. Backups, profile, security numbers for the same contact, etc.

Telegram allows you to have up to 3 accounts with one phone number but your account username is saved on Telegrams servers. Signal currently only stores your phone number and the last time your connected to Signal services.

I would like to have multiple accounts and would prefer to do away with a requiring a phone number to use Signal. Weather we use email addresses or signal user numbers, as long I can have a work, personal and a third account for gaming (Instead of using Steam or Discord for group chats) I would be very happy!

posts.name: Dusscloud
posts.cooked:
I use Signal (personal prupose) and I have a dual sim phone (for personal/professional)

  • I would like to also use Signal for professional purpose … I can’t today unfortunately.
  • Signal is used also for my SMS message (both personal and professional). Once a professional contact sends me a sms, I replied without seeing he was on Signal. He received then a message from my personal number!

As other messaging app (whatsapp and telegram) allow to handle such a use case, I don’t see why it cannot be done with Signal

posts.name: SignalBoi1337
posts.cooked: Please add the possible to link multiple phone numbers / SIM cards together!

To show your vote/support for a feature request, please just tap/click the -symbol on the opening post of a topic instead of posting (which only creates a bunch of unnecessary notifications for other users following this topic). Thanks!
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
In my original post at the top of this topic I,named the option of giving users the ability to make infine profiles. One could use a different profile picture for different (groups of) contacts.

However looking back on this, such implementation might open up Signal to be used by scammers, catfishes and the likes, and that might have a negative efect on how people view Signal.

Maybe it should be possible to set different profiles for different contacts, but an alternative would be to allow one profile for each registered phone number. If you have two SIM cards and thus two numbers, you can have two different profiles. One phone number for work, one phone number for friends and family.

Of course before this feature can be implemented, Signal first has to support registering two or more phone numbers on the same device.

Meteor0id:

registering two or more phone numbers on the same device

There are some workarounds which exist now for this, with certain android handset vendors at least: Installing 2nd signalapp into Huawei PrivateSpace and the linked projects mentioned therein (samsung secureFolder + lineageOS secondary-system-profiles + the Shelter workProfile app) can make this happen somewhat-decently.

SignalBoi1337:

Please add

Looks like you are maybe wanting to create a “top N priority-wishlist” post over here in this mega-thread, perhaps? What's your most-missed-feature-ranking?

posts.name: Samuel
posts.cooked:
ProtonMail just recently added multiple account support on Android. Because of this I bought myself a personal account and now I can use my work account and personal account in the app.

I hope Signal adds this feature too! Work, personal, travel accounts and so on.

posts.name: PJ
posts.cooked: This addition will put Signal ahead of Whatsapp and Telegram. I wish more apps out there allows for multiple users to be login at once but not many do.
This would allow me to abandon other chat applications such as WhatsApp. All of my accounts in one app instead of me using many chat apps.

posts.name: Mighty Sashiman
posts.cooked:
this multi-account (dual until virtual-sims make it possible to have virtually any number of concurrent lines I guess) is a topic which only seems to have been addressed properly by telegram. Whatsapp does not support it, but at least some manufacturers (like oneplus) offer a “parallel app” system which enables 2 instances of the app to run. Signal sadly is not part of the supported apps. It would be indeed nice if signal could support at least dual-sim / dual-signal-account in the SAME instance of the app.
Multi-profiles on android sounds a total overkill.

This is what it looks like in the Telegram app:

1400×987
